channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Singapore to make announcement on F1 next week: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 PM

SINGAPORE - The fate of the Singapore Airlines Singapore Grand Prix will be announced this coming week, said Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing on Saturday (May 30).

item.title: Singapore in discussions with S. Korea, Australia, to establish 'green lanes' for travel
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Talks are underway with South Korea and Australia to establish "green lanes" for travel during the Covid-19 environment, said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing on Saturday (May 30).

item.title: Why Singapore cannot cut down on foreign workers the way other countries have: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Is Singapore prepared to have 2,500 babies born here every year grow up to be construction workers?

item.title: Thousands of jobs to be created from $13b in investment commitments secured in first 4 months of 2020: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 PM

They include tech firm Micron, which intends to add 1,500 jobs here over the next few years, and online retailers Shopee and Lazada.

item.title: Coronavirus: Selected ICA counter services to resume by appointment only
item.description:
May 30, 2020 4:31 PM

SINGAPORE - From June 2, the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) will resume selected services by appointment only, in line with the gradual resumption of the Public Service Division's delivery of services at physical touchpoints.

item.title: Racism and xenophobia resurfacing during Covid-19: MCCY minister Grace Fu
item.description:
May 30, 2020 3:41 PM

SINGAPORE - The Covid-19 outbreak has stressed Singapore's social faultlinesand increased tensions between foreigners and locals, Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Grace Fu said during a dialogue on race on Saturday morning (May 30).

item.title: 506 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 2 Singaporeans and PRs
item.description:
May 30, 2020 3:14 PM

The bulk of the remaining cases are foreign workers in living in dormitories.

item.title: Additional two months of rental waivers for stallholders at NEA-managed hawker centres
item.description:
May 30, 2020 12:53 PM

SINGAPORE - Rental waivers will be provided to stallholders in hawker centres managed by the National Environment Agency (NEA), or by NEA-appointed operators for an additional two months up till August.

item.title: Robertson Quay incident: Six men and one woman to be charged for flouting circuit breaker measures
item.description:
May 30, 2020 12:39 PM

"We take such breaches very seriously and will not hesitate to take action," Minister for the Environment and Water Resources Masagos Zulkifli said in a Facebook post on Saturday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some SBS City Direct and Express bus services to resume from June 2
item.description:
May 30, 2020 12:19 PM

SINGAPORE - With the circuit breaker to limit the spread of the coronavirus ending on June 1, several City Direct and Express bus services will resume from June 2.

item.title: Fighting for progressive workplaces wins SNEF executive director May Day award
item.description:
May 30, 2020 12:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Trade union veteran Koh Juan Kiat has received the distinguished service award, the highest accolade in this year's May Day Awards.

item.title: 3 newly admitted inmates and a nurse working at Changi Prison have tested positive for Covid-19
item.description:
May 30, 2020 10:48 AM

SINGAPORE -Three inmates, who had been newly admitted into prison, and a staff nurse working at the Changi Prison Complex have tested positive for Covid-19 in the past two months.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 30
item.description:
May 30, 2020 8:15 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, May 30.

item.title: Pre-schools gear up for reopening with ABCs of staying Covid-safe
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

From getting back-to-school resource kits ready to marking out designated seats for children, pre-school centres are preparing to welcome them back from Tuesday.

item.title: Singapore among Asian nations doing well in Covid-19 fight: WHO adviser
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Asian countries such as South Korea, Vietnam and Singapore are doing well in their fight against Covid-19, a World Health Organisation (WHO) adviser said, as he praised their efforts to increase hospital capacity, perform contact tracing and isolate patients.

item.title: Facebook page barred from receiving financial benefits after posting falsehoods
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Times Singapore Facebook page has been barred from receiving any financial benefit after it published a post with multiple false statements, at least three of which were the subject of a correction direction under Singapore's laws against fake news.

item.title: Employers, drivers must ensure workers are ferried safely
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

When more businesses resume from June 2, employers, transport providers and drivers must ensure that safe management measures are observed when workers are ferried on transport provided by employers, such as private buses, vans and lorries.

item.title: Coronavirus: Call to build up testing, contact tracing capacities before lifting lockdowns
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The go-to measure for many countries responding to the Covid-19 outbreak has been to put in place lockdowns like what the Chinese city of Wuhan - where the virus was first reported - did in January, said Canadian infectious diseases expert Bruce Aylward.

item.title: Millionaire starts foundation to give to pet causes
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Millionaire Mario Singh has taken a leaf out of new-school philanthropists' book - at age 43, he has set up a foundation so that he can start giving away his wealth early.

item.title: Coronavirus: Traineeships can pay off for mid-career job seekers, companies
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Both employers and job seekers can end up as big winners if trai-neeships for mid-career profes-sionals can take off on a large scale, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said yesterday.

item.title: No guarantee a vaccine can be developed, says professor
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite a global race to discover a safe and effective vaccine for Covid-19, there is still no guarantee that such a vaccine can even be developed.

item.title: NSF cyber specialists can now attend classes at NUS
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Full-time national servicemen (NSFs) under the work-learn Cyber NSF scheme will now be able to pursue their part-time tertiary studies at the National University of Singapore (NUS) after the school and the Ministry of Defence (Mindef) inked an agreement yesterday.

item.title: Rail sector remains bright spot for jobs, says Khaw
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Job opportunities are still plentiful for engineering students as Singapore continues work on rail sector projects in spite of the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, Transport Minister Khaw Boon Wan said yesterday.

item.title: Study using AI finds more effective drug mix to fight coronavirus
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

In the race towards a cure for Covid-19, repurposing drugs for other diseases may benefit patients afflicted with the coronavirus.

item.title: FairPrice, WhyQ launch new zero-commission food delivery platform
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Hawkers and smaller eateries looking to make use of the opportunities offered by going online now have a more affordable option.

item.title: SIM to offer traineeships for graduates, boost students' bursaries
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Private education provider Singapore Institute of Management (SIM) will give its graduating cohort op-portunities to get additional qualifications and new skills to boost employability, and will enhance its bursary support for students with financial difficulties.

item.title: Special masks for teachers so deaf students can read their lips easily
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Specially designed face masks for teachers are being made so that deaf students can lip-read what they are saying through a plastic see-through portion at the mouth area.

item.title: Climate talks postponed due to coronavirus pandemic but action must continue
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

On Tuesday, the United Kingdom presented a proposal to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) with new dates for the annual UN climate change conference.

item.title: Malaysia seeks to extend suspension of HSR project
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Malaysia has asked for a further suspension of the proposed Kuala Lumpur-Singapore High-Speed Rail (HSR) project, ahead of a May 31 deadline to decide whether to proceed with it.

item.title: Stagger hours, increase cleaning: Experts
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Reduced density, flexible work arrangements and more frequent cleaning are some immediate practices that employers can implement in their offices as Singapore gradually reopens its economy, said design and architecture experts.

item.title: Uncertain job prospects ahead but steps being taken to help
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

As the world battles an unprecedented pandemic, Singapore's job market is heading into uncertain territory - with vacancies likely to shrink, employers reluctant to hire and a large pool of workers expected to be looking for jobs in the coming months, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said yesterday.

item.title: Beautiful Science
High potential for more to work remotely as 57% of jobs are done by PMETs
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

There is high potential for more people to work from home regularly as 57 per cent of the jobs in Singapore's economy are done by professionals, managers, executives and technicians (PMETs), said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: President tours children's home virtually
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Styling a mannequin's hair as part of a course in hair fashion and design is fine, but keeping the mannequin in a dorm room at night can be quite unsettling. And studying mathematics alone, without guidance from a teacher or assistance from friends, can be a struggle.

item.title: Singapore, China to launch essential travel 'fast lane'
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and China will launch a "fast lane" for limited essential travel between the two countries next month. It is understood to be the first such arrangement of its kind.

item.title: Birdwatching in real time from the comfort of your couch
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic may be keeping birdwatchers off the jungle trails, but many are continuing to look for their feathered friends across the continents and the oceans - right from the comfort of home.

item.title: Different strategies needed for different segments of foreign workers
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as the world is buffeted by the rough waves of protectionist sentiments and travel restrictions, Singapore needs to remain an "open and safe harbour" for higher-skilled professionals, said Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hearings for most cases to resume from June 8
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The courts are set to resume hearings for most cases from June 8 - a week after Singapore exits the circuit breaker period - with remote hearings set to continue.

item.title: Getting classrooms clean and ready
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Madam Lee Phaik See, 46, an operations support officer at Jing Shan Primary School in Ang Mo Kio, cleaning on Wednesday high-touch areas such as desks and chairs in a classroom before pupils return to school on Tuesday, following the end of the circuit breaker period.Â

item.title: New material may be answer to crack-proof phone display screens
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Dropped your smartphone lately? Impact such as this often results in cracks and scratches to the display screen, sometimes even making it unusable.

item.title: Sino-Singapore 'fast lane' for essential business, official travel
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and China will launch a "fast lane" arrangement early next month to facilitate essential travel for business and official purposes between the two countries, as they emerge from the Covid-19 pandemic with control measures in place.

item.title: Free delivery of ST news tablet extended to June 30
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Free delivery of The Straits Times news tablet has been extended to June 30, even with some easing of social distancing measures starting next month, Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) has said.

item.title: Coronavirus: 7,800 BTO flats on offer in August; some projects may see delay of 6 months
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Home buyers who could not apply for a Build-To-Order (BTO) Housing Board flat this month because of the circuit breaker will be able to do so in three months, as the flats originally scheduled for launch this month will be combined with the August BTO exercise.

item.title: New high of 1,337 patients discharged; 611 new coronavirus cases
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

A record 1,337 Covid-19 patients were discharged yesterday.

item.title: Fewer groups registering as charities
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Fewer groups have been registering as charities in recent years, a development that observers say is due to a saturated sector and the resulting difficulties in competing for funds and resources.

item.title: Coronavirus: Work from home should be default option after circuit breaker, says MOM
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

When the circuit breaker ends, all companies - including those resuming operations in the first two phases of the economy's reopening - should adopt working from home as a default option.

item.title: Moved by the care, migrant worker pens grateful Facebook note
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

When he found out he had tested positive for Covid-19, Mr JM Jasim, a migrant worker from Bangladesh, felt sad but did not panic.

item.title: Dying wish to attend daughter's wedding fulfilled
item.description:
May 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Goh's dying wish was to attend his only daughter's wedding.
